<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 772, 91]]<|/det|>
4 Hot water is poured into a glass beaker and allowed to cool down for 5 minutes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate whether the rate of cooling of the hot water depends upon the initial temperature of the hot water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 152, 686, 167]]<|/det|>
The rate of cooling of the water can be calculated using the equation:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[320, 173, 679, 208]]<|/det|>
\[
\text { rate of cooling }=\frac{\text { decrease in temperature }}{\text { time taken }} .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 213, 305, 230]]<|/det|>
You are provided with:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 244, 341, 261]]<|/det|>
- a supply of cold water - an electric kettle

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 273, 355, 292]]<|/det|>
- a \(250 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\) glass beaker - a measuring cylinder.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 320, 567, 339]]<|/det|>
You may use any other common laboratory apparatus.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 351, 485, 368]]<|/det|>
You are not required to do this investigation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 380, 294, 399]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 413, 393, 430]]<|/det|>
- any other apparatus needed - a brief description of the method, including what you will measure and how you will make

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 445, 474, 462]]<|/det|>
sure your measurements are accurate - the variables you will control

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 474, 918, 493]]<|/det|>
- a results table to record your measurements (you are not required to enter any readings in the table)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 505, 614, 524]]<|/det|>
- how you will process your results to reach a conclusion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 536, 419, 553]]<|/det|>
